byline.contributor: Henry Meier contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

abstract: Meteorological forecasts promising torrential rains across California as El Nino weather system approaches are cause for as much concern as celebration; state emergency officials must prepare for floods and mudslides that can accompany heavy rains following extended droughts and conservationists hope water conservation will not go out the window.
lead_paragraph: Torrents of rain forecast for the end of the year could ease the drought but could also cause flooding and mudslides and reverse gains made in water conservation.

headline.main: For California, El Niño’s Dark Clouds Could Mean Rain but Also Trouble
headline.print_headline: Clouds of El Niño Could Mean Rain for California, and New Threats

snippet: Torrents of rain forecast for the end of the year could ease the drought but could also cause flooding and mudslides and reverse gains made in water conservation.
